putting it all together, what value does:
As a safe vault for ideas, that might be useful in a long future.

Record personal information safely, no one else will see, and I can analyse it to improve my self.

Save time developing small widgets to record personal info, without handling save&load mechanism myself.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles;I have written custom JavaScript
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with third-party desktop app (e.g. TidGi Desktop, twexe)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Git forge (GitHub, Gitea/Forgejo, GitLab);DIY (any other solution)

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: I only publish mod as plugin, so it won't pollute my own wiki.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
Friendly & fun community of developers, no pushing, no deadline, I can participate only when have spare time. So writing things on its codebase or community feels like an entertainment to play with.

Handful of web tools to use with tiddlywiki, so creating things on it is easy and have fast feedback.

I hope there can be more people to play together, so sharing things can be more fun.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I'm afriad AI makes note taking UI useless, so my investigation on it will be useless too. I myself might also only use AI, if AI can record everything I talk, and answer anything I ask (about personal info).

I afriad that there will be fewer new users, so only old guys that have stable usage, so creating is no longer fun on the cummuntiy, because things are stable, old people don't need new things.

I want to get more "thumb" when I share things. I hope there are new readers for my post.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
